Class.terms:description: A disposition is the tendency of a capability to be exhibited under certain conditions or in response to a certain stimulus (trigger).
Class.resource:example: solubility (to dissolve when put in fluid); fragility (disposition to break when dropped)
Class.rdfs:label: disposition

Class.terms:description: A function is a capability that satisfies some agentive objective, or (evolutionary) optimization.
Class.rdfs:label: function

Class.terms:description: A capability is a realizable entity whose basis lies in one or more parts or qualities and reflects possibility of an entity to behave in a specified way under certain conditions or in response to a certain stimulus (trigger).
Class.rdfs:label: capability

Class.terms:description: to modify is the capability to change some entity.
Class.rdfs:label: to modify

Class.terms:description: to record is the capability to detect and transcribe information in a specified format on some physical medium.
Class.rdfs:label: to record

Class.terms:description: to magnify is the capability to increase the appearance of the size of an object.
Class.rdfs:label: to magnify

Class.terms:description: to heat is a capability to increase the internal kinetic energy of a material.
Class.rdfs:label: to heat

Class.terms:description: to cool is the capability to decrease the internal kinetic energy of a material.
Class.rdfs:label: to cool

Class.terms:description: to freeze is the capability to decrease the internal kinetic energy of a material such that it changes state from a gas or liquid to a solid.
Class.rdfs:label: to freeze

Class.terms:description: to separate is the capability to i) distinguish some entities based on some attribute(s) and ii) subsequently physically displace them.
Class.rdfs:label: to separate

Class.terms:description: to ionize is the capability to physically convert an atom or molecule into an ion by adding or removing charged particles such as electrons or other ions.
Class.rdfs:label: to ionize

Class.terms:description: to supply energy is the capability to transfer energy from a source to a sink.
Class.rdfs:label: to supply energy

Class.terms:description: to observe is the capability to watch attentively.
Class.rdfs:label: to observe

Class.terms:description: dysfunction is a capability to act in a manner that is abnormal or opposite to the object's typical function.
Class.rdfs:label: dysfunction

Class.terms:description: to measure is the capability to obtain information about some entity by examining its attributes in relation to some reference metric.
Class.rdfs:label: to measure

Class.terms:description: to inject is the capability to administer a substance into some object through its external barrier.
Class.rdfs:label: to inject

Class.terms:description: to boil is the capability to increase the internal kinetic energy of a material such that it changes state from a solid or liquid to a gas.
Class.rdfs:label: to boil

Class.terms:description: to reduce energy is the capability to remove energy from a source.
Class.rdfs:label: to reduce energy

Class.terms:description: to supply electricity is the capability to transfer electricity from a source to a sink.
Class.rdfs:label: to supply electricity

Class.terms:description: to change appearance is the capability to change the material composition of an object.
Class.rdfs:label: to change materially

Class.terms:description: to demagnify is the capability to decrease the appearance of the size of an object.
Class.rdfs:label: to demagnify

Class.terms:description: to change appearance is the capability to change the visual attributes of an object.
Class.rdfs:label: to change appearance

Class.terms:description: to contain is the capability to bound or constrain a physical entity in some site.
Class.rdfs:label: to contain

Class.terms:description: to immobilize is the capability to contain an entity in such a way that it may not move in space.
Class.rdfs:label: to immobilize

Class.terms:description: to filter is the capability to retain certain entities based on selected attribute(s) while allowing other entities to pass through.
Class.rdfs:label: to filter

Class.terms:description: to excite is the capability to supply energy to a materila by bombarding it with energetic particles (e.g., photons).
Class.rdfs:label: to excite

Class.terms:description: to emit is the capability to release some physical entity (light, pollution, etc).
Class.rdfs:label: to emit

Class.terms:description: to change energetically is the capability to change the energetic aspects of an object.
Class.rdfs:label: to change energetically

Class.terms:description: to positively charge is the capability to remove an electron or add a positively charged ion to a chemical entity.
Class.rdfs:label: to positively charge

Class.terms:description: to negatively charge is the capability to add an electron or negatively charged ion to a chemical entity.
Class.rdfs:label: to negatively charge

Class.terms:description: to assemble is the capability to combine entities together into a larger object that persists in time.
Class.rdfs:label: to assemble

Class.terms:description: to extract is the capability to remove certain entities based on selected attribute(s) while allowing other entities to remain.
Class.rdfs:label: to extract

Class.terms:description: to transport is the capability to displace a material from one location to another.
Class.rdfs:label: to transport

Class.terms:description: to change spatially is the capability to affect the physical movement of some entity.
Class.rdfs:label: to change spatially

Class.terms:description: to regulate is to control or maintain the rate or speed of an object or process.
Class.rdfs:label: to regulate

Class.terms:description: to provide is the capability to make available some object to another that requires it.
Class.rdfs:label: to provide

Class.terms:description: to increase the rate of formation is to regulate the rate of formation in a manner that increases this rate relative to a reference process.
Class.rdfs:label: to increase the rate of formation

Class.terms:description: to investigate is the capability to uncover facts.
Class.rdfs:label: to investigate

Class.terms:description: A mutual disposition is a disposition that simulataneously invokes another disposition when realized.
Class.rdfs:label: mutual disposition

Class.terms:description: to consume is the capability to internalize a material entity.
Class.rdfs:label: to consume

Class.terms:description: to actively interact with is the capability to interact with another entity in a way that requires physical contact.
Class.rdfs:label: to actively interact with

Class.terms:description: to decrease the rate of formation is to regulate the rate of formation in a manner that decreases this rate relative to a reference process.
Class.rdfs:label: to decrease the rate of formation

Class.terms:description: to regulate the rate of formation is to modify the rate at which an object is formed.
Class.rdfs:label: to regulate the rate of formation

Class.terms:description: to serve as is the capability to act in a manner corresponding to some role.
Class.rdfs:label: to serve as

Class.terms:description: to serve as host is the capability to act in a manner that provides hospitality, serves to harbour an organism in or on itself.
Class.rdfs:label: to serve as a host

Class.terms:description: to infect is the capability to administer a disease-causing organism into some object.
Class.rdfs:label: to infect

Class.terms:description: to cause disease is the capability to materially change a biological object in that it functions abnormally.
Class.rdfs:label: to cause disease

Class.terms:description: to reduce the activation energy is to require a smaller amount of energy in order to form or break a chemical bond.
Class.rdfs:label: to reduce the activation energy

Class.terms:description: to increase the activation energy is to require a larger amount of energy in order to form or break a chemical bond.
Class.rdfs:label: to increase the activation energy

Class.terms:description: to change the activation energy is to change the amount of energy required to form or break a chemical bond.
Class.rdfs:label: to change the activation energy

Class.terms:description: to passively interact with is the capability to interact with another entity in a way that does not require physical contact.
Class.rdfs:label: to passively interact with

Class.terms:description: to be a part of is the capability to be assembled into a larger structure that persists in time.
Class.rdfs:label: to be a part of

Class.terms:description: to associate is the capability to physically interact with another object.
Class.rdfs:label: to associate

Class.terms:description: to be actively interacted with is the capability to be manipulated by some device or agent.
Class.rdfs:label: to be actively interacted with

Class.terms:description: to be passively interacted with is the capability of an object to be observed.
Class.rdfs:label: to be passively interacted with

Class.terms:description: to be recorded is the capability of an object to be observed in such a way that information about it can be transcribed in a specified format on some physical medium.
Class.rdfs:label: to be recorded

Class.terms:description: to be observed is the capability of an object to be perceived.
Class.rdfs:label: to be observed

Class.terms:description: to disassemble is to physically separate the parts of an object.
Class.rdfs:label: to disassemble

Class.terms:description: to disassociate is to cease or break association with some thing.
Class.rdfs:label: to disassociate

Class.terms:description: to interact with is a capabililty that involves another object.
Class.rdfs:label: to interact with

Class.terms:description: to be interacted with is the capability of an object to be target of a physical interaction.
Class.rdfs:label: to be interacted with

Class.terms:description: to translocate is the capability to displace oneself from one location to another.
Class.rdfs:label: to translocate

Class.terms:description: to be translocated is the capability to be physically displaced from one location to another
Class.rdfs:label: to be translocated

Class.terms:description: to be compared is the capability of an object to be examined in order to note the similarities or differences among a set of objects.
Class.rdfs:label: to be compared

Class.terms:description: to compare is the capability to examine in order to note the similarities or differences among a set of objects.
Class.rdfs:label: to compare

Class.terms:description: to examine is the capability to make detailed observation.
Class.rdfs:label: to examine

Class.terms:description: to be examined is the capability of an object to be observed in a detailed manner.
Class.rdfs:label: to be examined

Class.terms:description: to be a member of is the capability to be considered a part of a collection.
Class.rdfs:label: to be a member of

Class.terms:description: to distort is the capability to change the appearance of an entity by some transformation.
Class.rdfs:label: to distort

Class.terms:description: to bind to is the capability to physically interact with another object through a set of non-covalent interactions.
Class.rdfs:label: to bind to

Class.terms:description: to luminesce is to emit light through cold body radiation
Class.rdfs:label: to luminesce

Class.terms:description: to fluoresce is to emit light as a result of absorbing light or other electromagnetic radiation.
Class.rdfs:label: to fluoresce

Class.terms:description: to remove a covalent bond is the capability to covalently modify a chemical entity by removing a covalent bond.
Class.rdfs:label: to remove a covalent bond

Class.terms:description: to add a covalent bond is the capability to covalently modify a chemical entity by adding a covalent bond.
Class.rdfs:label: to add a covalent bond

Class.terms:description: to modify electronically is the capability to change the electronic properties of an object.
Class.rdfs:label: to modify electronically

Class.terms:description: to interact and to be interacted with is a mutual disposition of interacting objects.
Class.rdfs:label: to interact and to be interacted with

Class.terms:description: to gain a covalent bond is the capability of a chemical entity to have bonds added.
Class.rdfs:label: to gain a covalent bond

Class.terms:description: to lose a covalent bond is the capability of a chemical entity to have bonds removed.
Class.rdfs:label: to lose a covalent bond

Class.terms:description: to ingest is the capability to take into the body by the mouth for digestion or absorption.
Class.rdfs:label: to ingest

Class.terms:description: to produce is the capability to create new objects
Class.rdfs:label: to produce

Class.terms:description: to test a hypothesis is the capability to evaluate the truth value of a proposition based on gathered evidence.
Class.rdfs:label: to test a hypothesis

Class.terms:description: to characterize is the capability to classify the attributes or features of an entity against a reference classification.
Class.rdfs:label: to characterize

Class.terms:description: to describe is the capabilty to communicate facts about an entity.
Class.rdfs:label: to describe

Class.terms:description: to identify is the capability to determine the identity of something.
Class.rdfs:label: to identify

Class.terms:description: the capability to retrieve a (digitial/physical/mental) object from a location.
Class.rdfs:label: to retrieve

Class.terms:description: to store is the capability to place an object into a medium in which it can be retrieved in the future.
Class.rdfs:label: to store

Class.terms:description: the capability to encode information in a different representation
Class.rdfs:label: to encode information

Class.terms:description: the capability to maintain information such that it can be retrieved in the future.
Class.rdfs:label: to maintain information

Class.terms:description: the ability to reverse an encoding operation
Class.rdfs:label: to decode information

Class.terms:description: to serve as a template for molecular synthesis is the capability of a chemical entity to provide the necessary information or scaffold by which another molecule may be produced.
Class.rdfs:label: to serve as a template for molecular synthesis

Class.terms:description: to serve as a template for protein synthesis is the capability of a chemical entity to provide the necessary information or scaffold by which a protein may be produced.
Class.rdfs:label: to serve as a template for protein synthesis

Class.terms:description: to serve as a template for RNA synthesis is the capability of a chemical entity to provide the necessary information or scaffold by which an RNA molecule may be produced.
Class.rdfs:label: to serve as a template for RNA synthesis

Class.terms:description: to serve as a template for DNA synthesis is the capability of a chemical entity to provide the necessary information or scaffold by which a DNA molecule may be produced.
Class.rdfs:label: to serve as a template for DNA synthesis

Class.terms:description: to serve as a primer for DNA synthesis is the capability of a short nucleic acid to bind to the 5' end of single strand of DNA template and help initiate DNA replication.
Class.rdfs:label: to serve as a primer for DNA synthesis

Class.terms:description: to covalently modify is to materially change a molecule by adding or removing covalent bonds between atoms.
Class.rdfs:label: to covalently modify

Class.terms:description: to modify conformation of is to affect the spatial arrangement of an entity.
Class.rdfs:label: to modify conformation of

Class.terms:description: to cleave is to split or sever an object along a natural line or grain.
Class.rdfs:label: to cleave

Class.terms:description: to combine is the capability to modify a set of objects in a way that the object is merged with another object to form a new object or substance.
Class.rdfs:label: to combine

Class.terms:description: to breathe is the capability to inhale and exhale air into the body during respiration.
Class.rdfs:label: to breathe

Class.terms:description: to conformationally activate is to modify the conformation of an entity in such a way that it becomes activated or functional.
Class.rdfs:label: to conformationally activate

Class.terms:description: to conformationally inhibit is to modify the conformation of an entity in such a way that it functionally is reduced or inhibited.
Class.rdfs:label: to conformationally inhibit

Class.terms:description: to oxidize is the capability to remove an electron or an increase in oxidation state of a chemical entity.
Class.rdfs:label: to oxidize

Class.terms:description: to reduce is the capability to add an electron or an decrease in oxidation state of a chemical entity.
Class.rdfs:label: to reduce

Class.terms:description: to modify the oxidation state of is to change the number of electrons of a molecule, atom or ion.
Class.rdfs:label: to modify oxidation state of

Class.terms:description: to be modified is the capability to be actively interacted with in such a way that it leads to a physical reconfiguration.
Class.rdfs:label: to be modified

Class.terms:description: to be cleaved is the capability to be modified in a way that splits one part of the object from the other.
Class.rdfs:label: to be cleaved

Class.terms:description: to be covalently modified is the capability of a chemical entity to have bonds added or removed
Class.rdfs:label: to be covalently modified

Class.terms:description: to be combined is the capability to be modified in a way that the object is merged with another object to form a new object or substance.
Class.rdfs:label: to be combined

Class.terms:description: to be transported is the disposition to undergo motion.
Class.rdfs:label: to be transported

Class.terms:description: to be electronically modified is the capability of a chemical entity to have electrons added or removed.
Class.rdfs:label: to be electronically modified

Class.terms:description: to gain an electron is the capability of a chemical entity to receive an electron.
Class.rdfs:label: to gain an electron

Class.terms:description: to lose an electron is the capability of a chemical entity to lose an electron.
Class.rdfs:label: to lose an electron

Class.terms:description: to be activated is the capability to be modified in such a way that the conformational change leads to an increase in another capability.
Class.rdfs:label: to be activated

Class.terms:description: to be inhibited is the capability to be modified in such a way that the conformational change leads to an decrease in another capability.
Class.rdfs:label: to be inhibited

Class.terms:description: to be conformationally changed is the capability to be modified in such a way that the object's conformation is changed.
Class.rdfs:label: to be conformationally changed
